alert.note: Alert for Coastal Georgetown; Inland Georgetown (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Georgetown County through 500 PM EDT... At 430 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lambert, or 16 miles northwest of McClellanville, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Andrews, Lambert and Sampit. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
